title.narrative: Resource Efficiency Program for Brazil's Beef Supply Chain

description.narrative: Beef production is the largest contributor to Brazil’s GHG emissions, likely growing by 30% by 2023. This NAMA Support Project (NSP) catalyses a shift in approach and realises the huge untapped potential to enhance the sector’s efficiency by supporting the implementation of best practices across the supply chain. The NSP addresses barriers by providing awareness raising of efficiency benefits, technical assistance and finance packages to enable best practice investment, and EUR 11.25m in grants will generate a pipeline of such investment projects. EUR 4m will create a first loss guarantee facility to leverage EUR 40m in loans from development banks to finance pipeline projects and would leverage EUR 20m in private sector finance. A 5 MtCO2e emission reduction over NSP lifetime is estimated, plus 20 MtCO2e from avoided deforestation. The supply chain would also save EUR 260m in net resource costs, increasing productivity and recovering 66,000 ha of degraded pastureland.
